results.title: Australian Aborigines: living off the land
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land this film shows how Aborigines live on native animals and plants.
results.description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Modern social studies”.

results.title: Australian Aborigines: everything from nature
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Our reliance on manufactured goods is contrasted with the Aborigines’ ability to use the natural materials around them, which gives rise to a marked respect for their adaptability and sensitivity to the land. Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land.

results.title: Australian Aborigines: cooking
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Taken during the University of Sydney’s expedition to Arnhem Land, this film shows the traditional methods Aboriginals use to cook food.

results.title: Australian Aborigines: art, life and religion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Modern social studies”.
A simple portrayal of the aborigines’ belief that the spirit world and the material world are very closely linked. The spiritual significance of painting their bodies, dancing and singing is explained. Taken during the University of Sydney’s expedition to Arnhem Land, led by Professor A. P. Elkin in 1952.

results.title: Australian [colour] Diary. No. 11
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Tony Rasky, caricaturist, gives some impressions of famous sporting personalities - Lew Hoad, Herb Elliot, Peter Thompson. 2. Wellington airport, another ground link in the airways of the sky, opens with a spectacular display of flying, and exhibition of aircraft.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 038. Asian road
results.brief_description: Illustrates a Colombo Plan scheme being carried out in Thailand. Australia is helping to build a highway which will eventually cross Asia and link Teheran with Saigon. Each senior Thai engineer or technician has an Australian counterpart to assist with training and execution. Shows the conditions and difficult terrain which must be crossed.

Each senior Thai engineer or technician has an Australian counterpart to assist with training and execution. Shows the conditions and difficult terrain which must be crossed.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 035. Port Moresby
results.brief_description: A day in the life of Port Moresby, the capital city of Papua New Guinea. Shows early morning arrivals of fish, fruit and vegetables at the market, the flow of traffic into the city centre, the modern office buildings, indigenous buildings and artifacts, and finally people leaving work and relaxing on the beach.

results.brief_description: Magazine items: Orchids under the Southern Cross - Sixth World Orchid Conference in Sydney features Australian orchids. New Look at Old Crafts - traditional skills of Papua-New Guinea potters and weavers adapted to modern trade

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 031. Maryborough and hinterl
results.brief_description: A tour of Maryborough in Queensland, and minor towns in the district, showing their life and industries in a brisk and unconventional way.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 030
results.brief_description: Two colourful magazine items set at opposite ends of Australia. The area around Mt. Gambier, South-eastern Australia is a tourist centre shown to advantage in this film with brilliant photography by Don McAlpine, some of it underwater in the Blue Lake. The second item is in Tipperary, in the Northern Territory, showing the first attempts to grow sorghum in virgin soil areas.
